results.title: Isolation technique
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates how to perform medical aseptic techniques when caring for a patient with a communicable disease. Shows how to set up an isolation unit; how to organise the work; when and when not to wear the isolation gown and mask; how and when to wash the hands; how to remove and clean items used in the unit. Concludes with a short summary of basic principles to be observed when caring for a patient in isolation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Dept. of the Navy and Willard Pictures

results.title: The N.P. patient = The Neuro psychiatric patient
results.creator_credit: Bureau of Aeronautics and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
A training film designed to help naval hospital staff deal with and help sailors with various psychiatric and behavioral problems, ie the neuro-psychiatric patients.

results.title: Surgical dressings
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates the application of surgical dressings in a naval hospital during World War II. Shows the correct procedures for setting-up the trolley containing instruments, dressings and disposal items. Shows how to minimise infection by ensuring procedures are as sterile as possible.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”

results.title: Post operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Describes how to make an anaesthetic bed and how to put a patient in bed after an operation with minimal movement. Describes how a patient must be watched and every reaction noted while regaining consciousness.

results.title: Because it's just me
results.creator_credit: Richard Even, Jan E Skrentry and WNVT Northern Virginia
results.brief_description: Encourages students to examine their own talents., abilities, likes and dislikes and visualise how these might influence their future career choices, opportunities and leisure activities. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Beautiful people [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jasmin Disdar, Ben Woolford and Beautiful stories
results.brief_description: The ethnic conflict in the former Yugoslavia is an unlikely subject matter for this British black comedy which uses the Balkan war as a catalyst to explore a contemporary London bursting with racial discord. The films interconnected stories are set off by a brawl between a Serbian (Dado Jehan) and a Croatian (Faruk Pruti) on a busy downtown London bus, an apt and humorous metaphor for the worsening situation. Meanwhile a headmaster’s football hooligan son, inadvertently lands right in the middle of the war, a Tory MP’s daughter (Charlotte Coleman) falls in love with one of her patients and a BBC war correspondent suffering from ‘Bosnia syndrome’ tries to amputate his leg. Cast also includes Charles Kay, Julian Firth, Edward Jewsebury, Edin Dzandzanovic, Gilbert Martin. (Award: 1999 Winner-Un Certain Regard, Jasmin Disdar)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jasmin Disdar, Ben Woolford and Beautiful stories

results.title: Beating the bracken
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Recommends methods of removing bracken from the rich dairy country in the New South Wales coastal belt. Explains that broken bracken is the first stage in the removal of the pest. Illustrates the use of specially designed three-bladed rollers on hilly country. On level pastures the simple square log roller with steel flanges, the mower, the rotary hoe, or other mechanical equipment are suggested.
